arts.ttl: Max Eberl frustrated with Bayern Munich’s draw against Union Berlin
arts.sum: While opportunities to break down the steely Union defence were far and few, Bayern took their chance when it came and scored their lone goal of the game. Bayern Munich had to walk with just one point after a hard fought clash with Union Berlin.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich’s Leroy Sané does not pay too much attention to his body language after skirmish prior to Union Berlin draw
arts.sum: I’m the first one to be unhappy when things don’t go well. I’m trying my best to help us win games,” the 30-year-old said (as captured by X account @iMiaSanMia ).

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany nonplussed about Bayern Munich’s performance in 1-1 draw against Union Berlin
arts.sum: But I’ve been in football long enough to know that this wasn’t a bad performance away from home. Bayern Munich slipped up a bit after a 1-1 draw with Union Berlin.

arts.ttl: Leroy Sané knows Bayern Munich has no excuses after 1-1 draw at Union Berlin
arts.sum: It was another weekend where Bayern dropped points in the Bundesliga on either side of wins in the Champions League vs. For the second weekend in a row, Bayern Munich have dropped points in the Bundesliga, this time at the hands of Union Berlin.
Bayern Munich midfielder Joshua Kimmich has signed a four-year contract extension to keep him at the club until 2029.

arts.ttl: Leroy Sané underlines desire to stay at Bayern amid exit talk
arts.sum: Following reports linking him with a move to the Premier League, Leroy Sané has reiterated his desire to remain at Bayern Munich.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany: "We're not happy with the result, but it wasn't a bad performance"
arts.sum: Vincent Kompany was disappointed that Bayern could only draw against Union Berlin, but didn't think the performance was bad.

arts.ttl: Four Observations from Bayern Munich’s uninspiring 1-1 draw against Union Berlin
arts.sum: Bayern gift Leverkusen another chance to make up points in the Bundesliga title race. A memorable, and pretty accurate, piece of commentary until the second half where Jonas Urbig failed to live up to, what looked like, his years of experience.

arts.ttl: Match Awards from Bayern Munich’s frustrating 1-1 draw against Union Berlin
arts.sum: Though goalkeeper Frederik Rønnow and former Bavarian turned Union’s goalscorer Benedict Hollerbach had fantastic performances tonight, it is captain Christopher Trimmel who deserves the jersey swap. In several moments when the low-lying midfield and defense of Union forced the Bavarians to give up the ball and make mistakes, but Dier teamed with Upamecano, who would retrieve the ball and stop Union’s progression.

arts.ttl: European football: Bayern extend lead despite Hollerbach’s late sting
arts.sum: Union Berlin hold Bayern Munich to 1-1 draw Sané opens scoring before Hollerbach punishes error A moment of uncertainty from the goalkeeper Jonas Urbig allowed Benedict Hollerbach to score a late goal as Union Berlin secured a 1-1 home draw on Saturday with Bayern Munich, who still extended their lead atop the Bundesliga standings to nine points. Bayern, chasing a record-extending 34th league title, climbed to 62 points. Champions Bayer Leverkusen, who are in second place, have a game in hand and travel to face Stuttgart on Sunday.
